page.title: 04LONDON BRICK COMPANY
page.content: How does London Brick make its products? Firstly it buys up the agricultural land in the area. Some depth beneath the fairly good farm land is a clay that is the brickmakers boon. This is known as "knotts" and is so good for its purpose that the bricks almost make themselves. It contains oil that provides 2/3rds of the of the fuel needed for firing. The clay lies in layers about 50 feet thick and usually a large overburden of top soil and other material has to be removed. The waste is deposited in that part of the quarry already worked. A worked out pit may be over 100 acres in area and after a passage of time becomes a scene of devastation.
